page.title: 14TOURISM-FARNINGHAM
page.content: Farningham is one of the prettiest villages close to London. It is a conservation village, one of the 3 protected villages in Kent. The old millhouse and the old houses by the the bridge over the River Darent are always an attraction for visitors. The old manor house was once the house of Captain Bligh of the Bounty. Many of the houses are timbered, weatherboard and Kentish Clapboard. Many people visit the 13th century church which has a very special font and an alabaster memorial to the Roper Family, some people get permission to rub the very fine brass rubbings. In 1984 there was a pageant to celebrate 500 years of the church, it attracted many visitors. Morris dancers come to dance in the village every year at our village pub which is an old coaching-inn.
